news.title: Desert tortoises can't take the heat of roadside fencing
news.summary: Home Biology Ecology August 5, 2017 August 5, 2017 by Kat Kerlin Desert tortoises pace back and forth and can overheat by roadside fencing meant to help them, according to a study published in the journal Biological Conservation by the University of…

news.title: Desert tortoises can't take the heat of roadside fencing
news.summary: Desert tortoises pace back and forth and can overheat by roadside fencing meant to help them, according to a study published in the journal Biological Conservation by the University of California, Davis, and the University of Georgia.

news.title: Desert tortoises can’t take the heat of roadside fencing
news.summary: Desert tortoises pace back and forth and can overheat by roadside fencing meant to help them, according to a study published in the journal Biological Conservation by the University of California, Davis, and the University of Georgia.

news.title: Highway fences can harm tortoises they were built to save - Futurity
news.summary: Desert tortoises can overheat as they look for a way around roadside fencing meant to keep them safe from cars, a new study suggests.
